loans.models¶

class loans.models.ActiveLoan(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Each ActiveLoan is an instance of this class.

computeMonthlyInstallment()[source]¶

Returns the monthly installment based on the current outstanding loan balance, monthly interest rate and remaining months.

computeOutstandingLoanBalance()[source]¶

Returns the balance outstanding after elapsedMonths have passed (assuming all installments were paid on time.) Notes on usage: Call this function once after paying every installment (when you increase elapsedMonths). Set outstandingLoanBalance using the value returned by this function. After that use that variable to query the outstanding loan balance.

save(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Updates monthlyInstallment and saves the entry

class loans.models.Application(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This stores information a user fills while applying for a new loan. This information is transferred to loan object once the application is approved.

class loans.models.CompletedLoan(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Record for every completed loan.

class loans.models.Customer(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Each customer of the bank is an instance of this class.

class loans.models.Loan(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Each loan a customer take is an instance of this class. A customer can be associated with one or more loans.

class loans.models.OverdueInstallment(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This class stores all the installments which have passed their due dates and haven’t been paid yet

class loans.models.Payment(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Record storing every transaction

class loans.models.SupportTicket(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This stores information about any complaint a user might have.

loans.models.firstSaveHandler(sender, instance, created, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This function is used to set the outstanding loan balance and elapsed months when the loan object is created. Argument Explanation: sender - The model class. (ActiveLoan) instance - The actual instance being saved. created - Boolean; True if a new record was created.
